entry.title: Fractured Minds
entry.summary:
Author: Cryptocol

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 197,090Chapters: 82/?Kudos: 349

Summary: Buck has always been the charismatic, go-getter firefighter with a penchant for making people laugh and jumping headfirst into dangerous situations. But for years, something about him felt off—like a piece of himself was missing or out of place. As his life continues to unfold, he starts to notice strange gaps in his memory, moments where his behaviour shifts inexplicably, and flashes of emotions he doesn't understand. When Eddie Diaz, the new firefighter, joins the 118, he begins to feel a shift in his life. Eddie, with his steady and empathetic presence, doesn’t shy away when his struggles surface. Instead, Eddie becomes an anchor, slowly helping him peel back the layers of confusion and uncover the truth—Buck has Dissociative Identity Disorder (DID).With the unwavering support of everyone at the 118, he finds the courage to trust himself, his system, and the people around him, finding the strength to open up and let others in. Through love, patience, and acceptance, he learns that healing doesn't mean repressing or fixing the different parts of himself - it means embracing them and finding a way to live with them.

entry.title: The Wild Boy
entry.summary:
Author: Warlock_Nerd

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 27,918Chapters: 27/28Kudos: 680

Summary: The 118 get a call to some nearby woodlands where the police are waiting for their assistance. Athena tells them that they need to help with a little boy that had gotten his leg stuck in a beartrap. All seems simple but then she tells them that the boy is a feral child, animalistic and frightened, and was throwing rocks at people who tried to get closer. Buck and Eddie are tasked to get him to safety.The boy is scared of everything around him, people, sounds, objects, the wind, the smells. Terror is all the boy knew until he found something he wasn’t scared of.And its name was Evan Buckley. :3Warnings - Heavy descriptions of medical trauma, child abuse, neglect and injury.Queue found family, Christopher being an amazing big brother and the 118 being the best family in the entire world. :3

entry.title: The Adventures of Eddie Diaz
entry.summary:
Author: Doglover2024

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 492Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 6

Summary: In a world where heros are expected to be strong and unbreakable, Eddie Diaz finds himself facing an unexpected challenge- age regression. As he navigates his new reality, his friends from the 118 are determined to support him, but it's Buck who steps up in a way no one anticipated. WIth Buck becoming his care giver, they embark on a journey filled with love, vulnerability, and the importance of family. Together, they learn that strength comes in many forms, and sometimes embracing the past can lead to a healing present.

entry.title: come get me, this place is haunted
entry.summary:
Author: Buddieaya

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,111Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 52

Summary: "I keep hearing screaming at night."Buck straightens a little, suddenly curious. "What kind of screaming?"Eddie's face flushes instantly, that adorable slow burn blush starts to creep down his face and neck. Buck leans in instinctively, phone cradled close, studying every inch of his expression."What kind of screaming, Eddie?" he repeats, a slow smile spreading across his face.He's always been a sucker for how easily Eddie blushes, it's practically a sport."Moaning screaming," Eddie mutters, eyes darting away."Sexy moaning?""Buck." Eddie groans, dragging both hands down his face and turning away from the phone trying to escape his questioning."I mean, Eddie come on," Buck raises his hands in defence. "Before you go to horny ghost, have you thought that maybe your neighbours aren't just... y know — getting enthusiastic?""I don't have neighbours," Eddie snaps, spinning back to face him with a glare. "This house is isolated as hell, like in the middle of nowhere... creepily far from everyone.""So the only logical explanation," Buck says, eyes dancing with amusement, "is that you have a sexually frustrated ghost with a hat kink?"Or; Horny ghosts?

entry.title: accident prone
entry.summary:
Author: renecdote

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,602Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 127

Summary: When Buck shows up with a toolkit in one hand and a paper bag full of burgers in the other, he has no intention of having sex with his best friend. He’s not even thinking about sex. He’s here for a few days to help fix up the house, maybe give Eddie a hug, definitely get his ass kicked playing games on Chris’ new PS5. He doesn’t know quite how they got here: Eddie’s back against the new kitchen counter, his dick in Buck’s mouth, one hand twisting tight in Buck’s hair. The one where sex doesn't mean anything (except for how it means everything).

entry.title: Lead Me to the Light
entry.summary:
Author: purexheart

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,317Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 7

Summary: Buck knits his brows together. Hen and Chimney were right. He can’t remember the last time he’s needed to have the weight of Eddie’s hand pressing down on his shoulder to feel his calming influence cut through the hectic energy from an emergency call so that he could pinpoint the exact location of another person trapped in a fire. Or, when he no longer needed to hear Eddie’s voice to be able to quel the rage within him. Their bond has grown beyond that of a normal working sentinel and guide partnership.He glances up from the floor and looks towards Eddie. Eddie, who’s on the other side of the firehouse. Eddie, who’s already looking back at him, head tilting as a contemplative look passes over his features. Buck feels his heartbeat return to normal with just that glance, solidifying his thoughts.He was fucked.

entry.title: Everything We Don’t Say Out Loud
entry.summary:
Author: Katieeekattt333

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,684Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 6

Summary: Eddie Diaz moves to El Paso to get his life back on track and reconnect with his son, Christopher. But things aren't so simple. Eddie’s still struggling with his identity, and to make matters more complicated, he realizes he’s in love with his best friend, Buck. Conversations with his parents and his own self-doubt send Eddie spiralling back into old habits. When he finally moves back to LA, living with Buck brings up all the emotions Eddie’s been avoiding. Now, he has to figure out who he really is, face his feelings for Buck, and decide what he wants for his future while grappling with the weight of his habits.
